learning_outcomes.description: Understand the importance of policy and international settings in the context of cyber incident response.
Develop plans for creating, revising, or modifying incident response teams tailored to specific organizational contexts.
Formulate effective incident response plans and propose playbooks for different types of incidents.
Analyze and categorize incidents, establish secure processes for containment and analysis, and manage digital forensics and evidence collection.
Collect and analyze cyber incident information and produce incident reports suitable for stakeholders.
Extract and organize information for reporting and sharing with other stakeholders, while actively collaborating within small teams to achieve organizational objectives.

assessments.due_date:
Week 2 - Week 11

Exercises due before each tutorial (10 in total)
assessments.task_description: There are 10 tutorials, starting from week 2, ending in week 11 and due date for each exercise is before each tutorial. Simple exercises cover the knowledge learned in the previous lecture.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Lectures (Lecture): Lectures will be mainly used to introduce new material. There will also be time during lectures specifically for getting help with assignments.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Lectures (Lecture): Lectures will be mainly used to introduce new material. There will also be time during lectures specifically for getting help with assignments.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial

Tutorials will be mainly used to work on exercises on the lecture material. This will be a more interactive process than lecture presentations. The intent is to provide a learning environment that provides better support for the content covered in this course. There will also be time during tutorials specifically for getting help with assignments.

Each week, tutorials will focus on one practical tool or concept related to Incident Response (IR). While the lectures will cover the necessary theoretical knowledge expected at a Masters level course, the course will also provide you with exposure to various tools by its completion.
